Backend Developer Job Description

Job Title: Backend Developer

Job Type: Full-time

Location: Remote

Job Overview

We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer with strong experience in building scalable, maintainable, and testable backend systems using NestJS and modern best practices. You will play a critical role in designing and developing backend services, integrating third-party systems, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality features.

Key Responsibilities

Backend Development

  • Architect and develop scalable, maintainable, and secure backend services using NestJS and TypeScript
  • Design clean and RESTful APIs in collaboration with frontend teams
  • Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests for high test coverage and reliability
  • Follow SOLID principles, clean architecture, and best coding practices
  • Handle third-party API integrations (e.g., payment gateways, CRMs, analytics)
  • Write clear documentation and contribute to the internal knowledge base

Database Design & Management

  • Design and optimize relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL)
  • Write performant queries, indexes, and migrations
  • Ensure data integrity, consistency, and scalability

System Design & Integration

  • Participate in architecture discussions and code reviews
  • Work closely with product and engineering teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions
  • Handle asynchronous processing, job queues, and external service integrations

Docker & Infrastructure (Bonus)

  • Build and maintain Dockerized environments for local and production
  • Collaborate with DevOps or infrastructure teams on CI/CD pipelines and deployment strategies
  • Familiarity with Docker Compose, Kubernetes, Terraform, or cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure)

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • 4+ years of backend development experience, with 2+ years using NestJS
  • Proficiency in TypeScript and Node.js ecosystem
  • Strong understanding of software design patterns, modular design, and layered architecture
  • Deep experience with SQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and ORM tools (e.g., TypeORM, Prisma)
  • Experience writing clean, testable code with Jest, Vitest, or similar frameworks
  • Experience integrating with third-party APIs and handling external data flows
  • Familiarity with Git, GitHub/GitLab workflows, and Agile methodologies
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Flexible work hours and remote work options
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development
  • A collaborative and supportive team environment

descriptionText:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

We are looking for exceptional designers, who share our passion for impacting the lives of millions of engineers, enterprises, entrepreneurs and consumers every day. These roles sit in our central Design team, who help and learn from each other while working closely with colleagues throughout the organization.

With a diverse team of design colleagues, you will work on a variety of projects evolving our brand guidelines and applying them to communications materials, our UI design system, and graphic design for digital products.

Clear, stylish presentation that aids the user experience of our products is how we raise the bar and reach the widest audience. Real content and information will be at the core of the designs you produce.
